article.title: Things To Do At Night In Mexico City: 10 Spots To Experience Nightlife
article.lead_paragraph:
When one thinks of “nightlife” in Mexico, generally vacation hotspots like Cancun or Puerto Vallarta come to mind -- seldom to the words “party” and Mexico City seems like it would go hand in hand, but Mexico City locals, known as “Chilangos” know that you don’t have to go to a [beach town](https://trip101.com/article/21-things-to-do-in-playa-del-carmen) for a good time. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k6a-ic0MA3s&autoplay=1

Want to go out and enjoy the fun after hours in Mexico City? Be sure to check out these 10 spots.

snippets.title: 1. Mama Rumba
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BQ9RNvrhTDd/?taken-at=26802268

Live music lovers and aspiring salsa dancers, rejoice! Mama Rumba is the perfect place to go in Mexico City for those looking for a lively night of Latin music salsa dancing and a good time. This place is great for both tourists and locals looking to enjoy music until late in the night, as the party goes on until 3 am -- no worries if you don’t know how to salsa, the Chilangos will be happy to teach you. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yy-tQHSbEEY

>#### Mama Rumba 
>
>**Facebook**: [Mama Rumba](https://www.facebook.com/mamarumba.rl)

snippets.title: 2. The rooftop of Condesa D.F.
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BSRnpmSjPEc/?tagged=condesadf

Rooftop drinks in Mexico City? Yes, please! This gorgeous all-white rooftop is one of the best places to go in the city for a drink with some views. Though not a place to “party” all night -- the rooftop of Condesa D.F. is a great way to spend a laid-back night of drinking, conversation and people watching -- or it's the perfect place to start off your party. 

>#### Condesa D.F.
>
>**Website**: [Condesa D.F.](https://www.condesadf.com/restaurant.html)

snippets.title: 3. República Del Distrito Club Polanco
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/32E9lCNVfP/?tagged=republicadedistrito

Located in the city’s most posh neighborhood, Polanco, this is the perfect place to see the nightlife of Mexico City come spring to action. Always bustling, always filled with the trendy Mexican elite, this is a place where Chilangos dress to impress and come to party. From house music, to EDM and more, Republica Del Distrito is well known in the city -- but remember -- reservations are required. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZmpoh5PUug

>#### República Del Distrito Club Polanco (currently closed)
>
>**Website**: [República Del Distrito Club Polanco](http://www.republicadeldistrito.com/)

snippets.title: 4. Love in Polanco
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BQpxx-ajDXb/?taken-at=9770660

Does your weekend start on Friday night? Not at Club Love in the famous district of Polanco. Here, Wednesday nights are the nights to be out and about and enjoy the fast-paced, upbeat energy of Club Love. Here, visitors and locals dance their heart out to music by the country’s top DJs in a vibrant venue open until 4 am. If you’re in the city on a Wednesday night, this is the best place to use your dancing shoes, flaunt a nice outfit and enjoy cocktails, dancing and an unbeatable non-stop party while in Mexico City. 

>#### Love in Polanco
>
>**Website**: [Love in Polanco](http://lovepolanco.com.mx/)

snippets.title: 5. Palacio de Bellas Artes
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BSbxWtaBmaF/?tagged=palaciodebellasartes

No, in terms of traditional "party all-night" places, the Palacio de Bellas Artes does not qualify -- however; if you're looking for an after hours adventure that diverges from the party scene, this is the place to be. The absolutely breathtaking museum frequently holds events at night including nighttime tours, ballets, plays, galas and more. While the museum is incredible during the day as well, the Palacio de Bellas Artes is truly a cant-miss sight after sunset. 

>####  Palacio de Bellas Artes
>
>**Website**: [Palacio de Bellas Artes (in Spanish)](http://www.palacio.bellasartes.gob.mx/)

snippets.title: 6. Museo de Tequila y Mezcal
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BRwtlxfBjY_/?taken-at=218308166

Mexico's favorite liquor comes to life at the Museo de Tequila y Mezcal. While taste testing the various tequila and mezcal selections during the day is definitely possible, we'd recommend going Thursday-Saturday after dark, when the museum is open until 2:30 am. Enjoy a guided tour and learn about all of the different types of tequila and mezcal produced in Mexico -- the museum has hundreds to choose from. Best of all, you're welcomed by a margarita upon entrance and given access to a gorgeous open balcony to enjoy your drinks. 

>#### Museo de Tequila y Mezcal
>
>**Website**: [Museo de Tequila y Mezcal (in Spanish)](http://www.mutemgaribaldi.mx/)

While you are there, why not join a tour at the Plaza Garibaldi and enjoy a Festive Mexican Folkloric Show: A Mariachi Variety Show where you can dance the night away. Grab the complimentary drink , and enjoy yourself! If you have any questions, there's a professional guide who can answer all of your queries.

> #### Garibaldi by Night - Mexico City
>
> **Duration**: Approximately 3 hours
>
> **Price**: From 50 USD
> 
> [Get Your Guide](https://www.getyourguide.com/mexico-city-l194/garibaldi-by-night-mexico-city-t3697/?referrer_view_id=0580c0d0d3eb517e6865d325f6a3f0d6&referrer_view_position=2)

snippets.title: 7. Jules Basement
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BAvpwBJhYMK/?taken-at=236028826

Jules Basement is a Polanco treasure that gives visitors a bar experience unlike any other in Mexico City. The sleek lounge and ambient lighting gives the venue a chic, upscale feel combined with traditional Mexican culture like skulls as the base of the tables. This is undoubtedly one of the best bars to go to in Mexico City if you're looking for a speakeasy vibe and and killer cocktails. Visitors can also enjoy live music with their drinks, as this beloved bar frequently has events like Jazz nights. 

>#### Jules Basement
>
>**Website**: [Jules Basement](http://www.julesbasement.com/?lang=en)

snippets.title: 8. Teotihuacan at Night
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BSZzoOTllCx/?taken-at=220227925

The ancient pyramids of Teotihuacan are a must-see during the day. Labeled a UNESCO world heritage site, these famous pyramids are full of Aztec history and pre-colonial Mexican culture, but at night is when they come alive. This ancient city of the Gods transforms into an enchanting light and sound show, during which visitors are able to experience the story of this intriguing city through live narration. 

>#### Teotihuacan Tours
>
>**Website**: [Teotihuacan Tours](http://en.mxcity.mx/2016/05/teotihuacan-tours/)

snippets.title: 9. See a show at Patrick Miller
snippets.title_with_numbering: 9. See a show at Patrick Miller
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BSXEDjvlGtJ/?taken-at=246984908

Patrick Miller might not sound like a Mexican name, but the name "Patrick Miller" is practically a household name in Mexico City. Chilangos know this famous dancehall as the best place in Mexico City to let loose and enjoy a night of disco, electronic music, costumes, dancing and people of all ages looking for a party. The huge venue is always a high-energy dance party, and those looking for an unforgettable night in a quintessential modern-Mexican dancehall should find themselves at Patrick Miller. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWGhmjPNgA4

>#### Patrick Miller
>
>**Website**: [Patrick Miller](http://www.chilango.com/tragos/bares/patrick-miller-2/)

snippets.title: Fiesta in a city that never sleeps
snippets.title_with_numbering: Fiesta in a city that never sleeps
snippets.description:
Looking for a fiesta in this Latin city that never sleeps? While you may not have time to check out every place recommended above, you'll quickly find that nightlife in Mexico City will keep you wanting more. This truly is a city where you'll never get bored, and one could spend an entire lifetime trying to do it all. So while Cancun is definitely a party hot-spot for spring-breakers, for those looking for a true experience of Mexican nightlife the way the Mexicanos do it, CDMX is the go-to destination.

If you wish to further explore Mexico City at night, why not go on a Segway tour.

> #### Mexico City Segway Tour: Reforma by Night
>
> **Duration**: Approximately 2 hours 30 minutes
>
> **Price**: From 95 USD
>
> [Viator](https://www.viator.com/tours/Mexico-City/Mexico-City-Segway-Tour-Reforma-by-Night/d628-9447P5)

navigator.introduction: A story teller, jet setter, and self-proclaimed media maven -- Hannah is always planning her next adventure, as well as her next professional endeavor. Her affinity for wandering the world and telling breathtaking stories has taken her to well over 20 countries (and counting) and inspired her to learn three languages (and counting!) When she’s not in-flight or on the way to the nearest airport, Hannah enjoys wandering through art galleries, discovering new neighborhoods and trying food from all over the world. To view more of her work, check out her portfolio on her website.
